MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. INVESTIGATION
The actual complainant is not clearly known.
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications; volunteer,
Section contractors on central.
Description (1) The agency shall require a staff member who has ongoing
contact with children or parents to be a person who has the
ability, experience, education, and training to perform the
duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The worker falsified information about a birth parent's children and
gave false information in court.
Investigation Interviews:
Birth Parent C
I attempted contact with Birth Parent C related to the allegations
by telephone on 11/18/2023 and 12/5/2023 without success. Birth
Parent C was reported be in a protected setting; and I left a
telephone message for her on 12/5/2023. I never received a return
call back.
Birth Parent D
On 12/5/2023 I interviewed Birth Parent D by telephone. Birth
Parent D reported the allegation was true. He reported what the
worker gave false information about in court was that she said he
does not get along with his children, which was false and also
disrespectful. Additionally, the worker reported that his mother
had missed a visit with his daughters, which was not true.
Relative E
Relative E was interviewed by me via telephone on 12/5/2023.
Relative E is Birth Parent D’s mother. Relative E reported Worker
4 told the court that she never showed up for visits that were set
2

up for Relative E by other agencies. Relative E said that was not
true because during that time visits were occurring at her home.
She said it was Worker 4 who was not forthcoming about a visit.
She said Worker 4 scheduled a visit for her with Child A on
11/30/2023 but did not inform her about it. Birth Parent D told her
about the visit, so that she did not miss it.
Relative F
Relative F was interviewed by me via telephone on 12/5/2023.
Relative F did not report any information related to this allegation.
Supervisor 3
On 12/8/2023 I interviewed Supervisor 3 by video conference via
TEAMS. She was not aware of Worker 4 making any false
statements about this case in court.
Worker 4
On 12/8/2023 I interviewed Worker 4 by telephone. Worker 4 was
not aware or any false statements she would have made in court.
I asked her whether there was a visit scheduled for Relative E on
11/30/2023 which she did not tell Relative E, about, or if she
reported Relative E had missed visits anywhere, or at any time.
She denied such. She reported not knowing why it was being
reported that she did not tell Relative E about the visit. She said
she contacted Relative E on 11/15/2023 to tell her there would be
a visit on 11/30/203. Then on 11/22/2023 after a parenting time for
Birth Parent D at the office, Relative E was in the lobby, and she
told Relative E again about the visit on 11/30/2023. She did not
recall documenting such in a social work contact but thought at
least one contact showed her contact with Relative E prior to the
11/30/2023 visit.
Document Review:
Child A and Child B’s MISACWIS case record which showed:
➢ Child A’s and Child B’s case was assigned to Wolverine on
2/8/2023.
➢ A 11/22/2023 social work contact about a parenting time for
Birth Parent D, which did not document Worker 4 telling
Relative E about a visit but showed her having
communication with Relative E during the time Relative E
was in the lobby. Also, a 11/30/2023 social work contact
documenting a visit for Child A and Child B that showed
Relative E in attendance and enjoying the visit.
Analysis Based on interviews and documentation, there is insufficient
evidence to support the allegation. Nor that Worker 4 did not have
3

the ability, experience, education, and training to perform the
duties assigned.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED.
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12207 Staff responsibilities.
Section (3) An agency shall require that a social service worker be
Description directly responsible for all of the following activities:
(a) Placing and supervising children in-out-of-home care.
Social services workers shall work directly with the children,
their families, and other relevant individuals and be primarily
responsible for the development, implementation, and review
of services plans for the children and their families.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation.
Type
Allegation The worker did things to block reunification and was disrespectful
to the family and children. Additionally, the worker tried to block
relatives from getting care of the birth parents’ children from foster
care because the worker's friend is the children's foster parent.
Investigation Interviews:
Birth Parent C
I attempted contact with Birth Parent C related to the allegations
by telephone on 11/18/2023 and 12/5/2023 without success. Birth
Parent C was reported be in a protected setting; and I left a
telephone message for her on 12/5/2023. I never received a return
call back.
Birth Parent D
On 12/5/2023 I interviewed Birth Parent D by telephone. Birth
Parent D reported the allegations were true. He said Worker 4
tried to make it seem as if no one on his side of the family wanted
to plan for his children. He reported his family tried to get his
youngest daughter, Child A placed with his brother, Relative F;
and the agency/Worker 4 put up road blocks against Relative F.
Birth Parent D did not elaborate on what he meant by road blocks.
He said his mother, Relative E, as well as his brother, Relative F
has tried to get placement of Child A since June 2023. He said,
Relative E was doing things to fix her house and also took the
classes to become a licensed foster parent. Additionally, his
mother, Relative E submitted clearances to get her, and her house
approved, but Worker 4 was not keeping Relative E, nor Relative
F aware of what was going on related to Child A and the case
4

plan. Nor did Worker 4 or her supervisor return Relative F’s
phone calls related to planning for Child A.
He reported Worker 4 did come to check his mother’s house out,
and also Relative F’s, but the agency placed Child A with Birth
Parent C’s parents (Relative G and Relative H) on 12/4/2023
instead. He reported that was interesting since Relative G and
Relative H had placement of his oldest daughter, Child B; and
Relative G had not wanted Child A prior. Relative G and Relative
H only recently had a desire to care for Child A.
I asked Birth Parent D whether the agency tried to block him from
planning for Child A and Child B. He reported he was incarcerated
for a while, but the agency reached out to him via letters to let him
know what was going on. They also visited his home once he was
released on 10/22/2023. He said both of his daughters’
permanency plan now is to live with Relative G and Relative H. He
reported his concern is that the agency didn’t timely pursue his
brother for placement of Child A, would not allow visitation for his
brother; was disrespectful to them by not telling the truth about
these relatives being available to plan for his children; and about
his mother missing a visit that was scheduled for her which she
had no knowledge about. He said his mother went eight months
without being able to see Child A; and when a visit was scheduled
for her to see Child A for two hours, he told her it was scheduled
as opposed to Worker 4. Also, since the agency would not allow
Relative F to see his girls, Relative F had to go through Ennis to
get licensed in hopes of getting Child A. He said both Relative E
and Relative F could verify this information.
Relative E
On 12/5/2023 I interviewed Relative E by telephone. Person XX
(reported to be the partner to Relative F) was also on the
telephone line with Relative E, and would periodically interject
statements. Relative E reported caring for Child B in the past
when Birth Parent C lived with her for 18 months. She said Birth
Parent C later left Child B with Relative G; and subsequently Child
A and Child B became involved with foster care. Relative E
reported after Child A's and Child B’s case was assigned to
Wolverine, she has had difficulties seeing the girls due to a lack of
contact from the agency. She said she was trying to get visits with
Child A and Child B in her home; and her son, Relative F was
trying to get placement of both girls. She reported calling Worker 4
over 10 times; and calling Supervisor 2 at least four times (in the
last 6 weeks) and none of her calls were ever returned. She later
said Supervisor 3 did call her back. Supervisor 3 told her,
5

Supervisor 3 would make arrangements for Relative E’s home to
be checked out, so that the agency could bring Child A and Child
B to her for visitation.
Relative E reported the agency was not trying to work with them
She and Person XX said Worker 4 only reached out to Relative F
once. Relative E reported the way she was able to see both girls
in August 2023, was after Relative G invited her to a sibling visit
for Child A in Relative G’s home. Relative E said Worker 4 did not
know she was going to be at the sibling visit; and Worker 4 was
upset about her being present. Relative E reported after that her
attorney contacted Wolverine on their behalf. She believes this
was how she was able to get later visits.
Relative E reported that Worker 4 never returned her contacts;
and never gave the agency’s licensing department her or Relative
F’s information related to them wanting to plan for/be involved with
Child A and Child B. Though, Relative E also reported it was only
after she left a message for Administrator 2 at the end of
September or early October 2023 did Worker 4 follow up with her.
She also reported Worker 4 came to check out her home in
August 2023; and sent a licensing worker to her home in October
2023 to check it out. Relative E reported when the licensing
worker came to her home, that worker was in error. That worker
was to have gone to Relative F’s home, because he wanted
placement of the girls. She only wanted home visits; but Worker 4
had given the licensing worker the wrong information. The
licensing worker said her home was okay for visitation.
Relative E believes all of this miscommunication and delay by
Wolverine blocked their ability to plan for Child A and Child B.
She believes Worker 4 being brief with her during an initial phone
contact in August 2023 and telling her to contact her attorney was
Worker 4 being rude and disrespectful to her.
Relative E reported knowing that Child A was placed in a foster
home that is a friend of Worker 4 because during Worker 4’s visit
to her home, Worker 4 reported such. She had asked how Child A
was doing in the foster home and Worker 4 stated the foster
parent’s first name; and said they need not worry. Worker 4 said
that foster parent is a good foster parent; and is a friend of her's.
Relative F
On 12/5/2023 I interviewed Relative F by telephone. Relative F
reported he had experienced aspects of the allegations, in that he
feels he was never offered the opportunity to get his nieces, Child
6

A and Child B. He said he was making calls to Worker 4, and she
was not returning his call. He did not report when he started
calling Worker 4 or the agency. He reported during his quest to
get placement of the girls he showed up for an August 2023
sibling visit, at Relative G’s and Relative H’s home. At that time
Worker 4 insisted he leave the visit but spoke with him afterward.
He inquired of Worker 4 how to get visitation with Child A and
Child B. Worker 4 told him to provide her with his driver license
and social security number so that clearances could be ran. On
this August 2023 date Relative F reported learning from Worker 4
that the telephone number he had goggled for Wolverine and was
calling/ leaving messages for Worker 4 was not the correct
number for the agency. On that date Worker 4 gave him her
business card with her correct contact information; and he
provided her the information she needed for clearances a short
time thereafter. Two weeks later he called Worker 4 to check the
status of his clearance checks. Worker 4 told him she turned his
paper work over to the agency’s licensing department and there
was nothing more she could do. Worker 4 made him feel as if he
was being a nuisance. Worker 4 did not say he was being a
nuisance; Relative F felt Worker 4’s tone of voice suggested that.
Relative F said Wolverine never assessed his home, but he
completed the licensing process via Ennis.
Relative F reported Wolverine recently told him he would not be
looked at for placement of the girls because Child A and Child B
are already placed with a relative. Relative F reported that’s true
now; but it was not true for Child A at first. Child A was placed in a
foster home that was a friend of Worker 4’s. He reported knowing
the latter because of what Worker 4 told him and his
mother/Relative E. He repeated basically what Relative E, had
reported related to the Worker 4/foster parent friendship
allegation. He said the agency never said that other relative
placement situation was why they were not considering him.
Relative F reported thinking Child A’s placement situation/her
being placed with the other relatives only recently as “shady
dealing”. He reported that to Supervisor 3. He reported having
contact with Supervisor 3 after Worker 4 was not returning his
many calls. He said, Supervisor 3 said he should deal with her.
He said when he first made contact with the agency, the agency
never told him they were trying to get Child A placed with Relative
G and Relative H. That when he started the process, Birth Parent
C and his brother (Birth Parent D, who was incarcerated), were
both in favor of him getting placement of both, Child A and Child
B; as well as him having visits with them. He said the birth
parents contacted their attorneys to say they were okay with him
7

as a placement plan. Birth Parent D’s attorney also contacted
Wolverine to say there was a relative willing to take placement of
the children. He believes Wolverine pushed back against the plan.
Wolverine only told him to not worry; that Child A was in a good
foster home. He reported, that since both girls are in a relative
placement now, the agency told him he would not be assessed
unless Birth Parent C’s and Birth Parent D’s parental right are
terminated. He reported being happy that Child A and Child B
are placed together/are united, but surprised that Relative G and
her family took placement of both girls, when Relative G had
questioned taking care of two children. He reported just wanting to
be there for the girls and wanting the agency to know that.
Supervisor 3
On 12/8/2023 I interviewed Supervisor 3 by video conference via
TEAMS. She denied the allegations. She reported when Child
A’s and Child B’s case transferred to Wolverine in February 2023;
Child B was already placed with Relative H and Relative G.
Relative E had previously cared for Child B, but there were issues
with that home; and that may be why Child A was not placed
there. Child A was placed in a foster home; and there were no
other known relatives willing to plan for Child A at the time.
Supervisor 3 said Relative F did not come forth about possibly
planning for Child A until August or September of 2023. The
agency completed clearances on him.
She reported no knowledge of phone calls not being returned by
Worker 4. Worker 4 never shared with her that relatives were
regularly calling her. Supervisor 3 reported she has never
observed Worker 4 with these relatives, but she has no reason to
believe that Worker 4 would be rude or disrespectful to them. She
said Worker 4 has been an employee of good standing for over
four years.
As for Relative E’s and Relative F’s interest in planning for Child
A, Supervisors 3 reported there was discussion with Relative F
and Relative E about their interest in placement. They asked who
wanted to be explored first. Relative E’s home was explored first
because Relative E submitted her clearance request information
first. Worker 4 got the paper work from Relative E on 8/29/2023;
and Relative F submitted information on 9/1/2023. That paper
work was turned over to Supervisor 3 in September 2023. She
ran criminal history clearances on Relative E on 9/27/2023, and a
children protective service (CPS) clearance some time prior to
10/2/2023. She turned Relative E’s paperwork over to the
agency’s licensing department on 9/28/203; and Relative F’s
8

thereafter, after running criminal history and subsequently CPS
clearances on Relative F and his LTP (Living Together Partner).
She reported their licensing department went out to Relative E’s
home to check it out for placement on 10/2/2023. At that time
Relative E was confused, Relative E did not seem to know the
licensing worker was there to assess her home for placement of
Child A. At that time, Relative E stated she did not want placement
of Child A. She only wanted to have visits in her home, which is
not what the agency had previously been told.
Supervisor 3 reported the agency did not ultimately follow up with
a home visit of Relative F’s home because, Relative G called the
agency to say she wanted placement of Child A. The agency
discussed this option, because it was an opportunity to have Child
A be with her sister. This placement option was also discussed
with Child A’s and Child B’s GAL (Guardian Ad Litem); and this
plan was recommended/agreed as in the girls’ better interest.
Supervisor 3 reported that’s when they let Relative F know what
would be happening with Child A’s placement; and what they
could do should Child A’s placement with the maternal
grandparents not work out. Relative F was okay with that.
Relative F asked her what happens if the birth parents rights get
terminated and Supervisor 3 explained that to him. Supervisor 3
reported since that conversation with Relative F in November
2023, as of 12/8/2023, Birth Parent C and Birth Parent D were
voluntarily releasing their parental rights.
As for Child A allegedly being placed in a foster home with Worker
4’s friend, Supervisor 4 denied such. She said Birth Parent D
brought that matter up at an FTM (Family Team Meeting) and they
reported it not to be true then. She said Foster Parent XY, and
Worker 4 are not personal friends. Worker 4 had another foster
child placed in Foster Parent XY’s home and has a good working
relationship with Foster Parent XY. Worker 4’s statements to the
relatives about Foster Parent XY’s home being a good foster
home would have been based on a worker/foster parent
relationship, nothing personal.
Worker 4
On 12/5/2023 I interviewed Worker 4 by telephone. Worker 4
denied the allegations. She reported neither Relative E, or
Relative F made calls to her that were not returned. Nor that she
was disrespectful to either. Nor that she tried to block any family
member’s desire to get placement of Child A or Child B. She
advised that Child B was already in placement with Relative G and
Relative H when the agency was assigned this case. Thereon,
9

she was working with Birth Parent C and Birth Parent D, prior to
Birth Parent C’s July 2023 in-patient rehabilitation; and Birth
Parent D’s June 2023 incarceration.
She reported Relative F never called her about planning for the
children. He just showed up for a parenting time at Relative G’s
and Relative H’s home on August 9, 2023. On that date Relative
F did report wanting to plan for Child A; and she advised him
clearances were required prior to him being allowed contact with
the children. She gave him her business card. She affirmed
Relative F’s report pertaining to him having an incorrect contact
number for Wolverine, him submitting paperwork for clearances
sometime in September 2023; and a follow up contact from him in
October 2023.
Worker 4 reported Relative E had reported wanting to plan for
Child A first. Relative E was showing up for her son, Birth Parent
D’s parenting time; and Relative E submitted clearance
paperwork, which Worker 4 reported turning over to their licensing
department. Worker 4 also confirmed the outcome of the
agency’s licensing worker’s home assessment visit to Relative E’s
home. Relative E did report at that time it was not her intent to
obtain placement of Child A but to get visits in her home.
Additionally, Worker 4 affirmed Supervisor 3’s reporting related to
the agency’s placement of Child A with her sister, Child B, in the
home of Relative G and Relative H; how that placement came to
be; and the agency’s explanation to Relative F as to not moving
forward and exploring his home due to reuniting the siblings.
Lastly Worker 4 denied being a personal friend of the foster parent
Child A had been placed with. Nor telling any of Child A’s family
members she was. She reported similar information as reported
by Supervisor 3, that she and Foster Parent XY had a good
working relationship based on her having a prior foster child in
placement with Foster Parent XY.
Document Review
Child A’s and Child B’s MISACWIS case which showed:
• Child A’s and Child B’s case was assigned to Wolverine on
2/8/2023.
• Child B was placed in Relative H’s and Relative G’s home
on 3/17/2022.
• Child A was placed in Foster Parent XY’s home on
2/8/2023.
10

• The children’s case plan was reunification at the time of
placement; and thereon the agency was working with the
birth parents.
• Child A was replaced from Foster Parent XY’s home and
placed with Child B in Relative H’s and Relative G’s home
on 12/1/2023.
• Child B and Child A were made temporary court wards on
3/17/2022 and 11/28/2022 respectively. They were made
permanent court wards on 12/8/2023.
• An FTM dated 11/7/2023 showing Relative G and Relative
H being explored for placement of Child A to unite siblings.
Information indicating Relative E only wants visitation;
Relative F to be explored for placement if the other
relatives do not work out.
• Social work contacts showing contact with relatives about
placement, inclusive of contact by Worker 4 with Relative F
on 9/1/2023. Also, Supervisor 3 with Birth Parent C about
Relative F on 11/7/2023; and with Relative F on 11/8/2023
about Relative F’s placement interest and the agency’s
current plan/exploration to unite siblings. Both Birth Parent
C and Relative F reporting they understood that.
Analysis Based on interviews and documentation, there is insufficient
evidence to support the allegations or to support that the worker
did not work with the children, their families, and other relevant
individuals related to the children’s service’s plan.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Continuation of the agency current licensing status is recommended.
